column4: my cron jobs is not running.  does anybody know how to see the error message ?
does anybody know how to debug cron jobs ?
there are several reasons why it might fail.
like what ?
Is it in your user's cron? Meaning "crontab -l" shows the scheduled job?
i can run it as that user, but it wont' run as a cronjob.  :(  and i don't know where to find errors.  when i put  >&  errors  it doesn't log errors either.
the entry itself can be wrong, the script might not be accessible and/or executable, or the script/command is trying to run interactively etc
Ok. Make it look like this: "/path/to/command >> /tmp/logfile 2>&1"
okay i'll try that
Also see output of "grep -i cron /var/log/syslog"
thanks I"ll try that too.  btw, what does  the 2&>1 part mean?
make STDERR and STDOUT go to the mentioned logfile.
thanks so much for your help.  I think I found the error!
ok!
have you installed correct kernel headers? sudo apt-get install linux-headers-`uname -r`
ok, let's check: "dpkg -l | grep linux-headers"
uname -r gives 2.6.28? installed headers are for 2.6.31
not sure what you are compiling, but whatever it is, it will try to find the header files of the current running kernel
my previous hint was "sudo apt-get install linux-headers-`uname -r`"
that is weird. Your installed header versions are > your current kernel.
indeed :)
no problem
